    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Bitboard
    A collection of bitboards and related constant values useful to perform efficient board manipulations, fast squares comparisons, and to mask some operations to limited portions of the board.
    Board
    The definition of a chessboard position and its status.
    BoardEvent
    An event emitted whenever a change of status happens or a move is played on the board.
    BoardEventListener
    An observer to board events.
    BoardEventType
    All possible types of a BoardEvent.
    CastleRight
    The different combinations of castle rights for a side in a chess game.
    Constants
    A handy collection of constant values to be used in common scenarios.
    DiagonalA1H8
    The representation of all possible right-pointing diagonals in a board.
    DiagonalH1A8
    The representation of all possible left-pointing diagonals in a board.
    Event
    A chess event.
    EventType
    The types of a chess event.
    File
    The files in a board.
    Game
    A chess game, as defined by the specifications of the Portable Game Notation (PGN) format.
    GameContext
    The definition of a game context, a support structure used to provide contextual information to a chess position, and most importantly to validate special moves in a uniform and consistent way according to the chess variation (e.g.
    GameFactory
    A factory for game-related components, such as games, events, rounds, and players.
    GameLoader
    A convenient loader to extract a chess game and its metadata from an iterator over the lines of the PGN file.
    GameMode
    All the possible modes of a chess game.
    GameResult
    All possible results in a chess game.
    GenericPlayer
    A generic player of a chess game.
    LargeFile
    An abstract representation of a potentially large text-based file that can be read line by line.
    Mode
    The game modes.
    Move
    The definition of a chess move, that is, a piece movement from its starting square (the origin square) to a destination square.
    MoveBackup
    A structure that can be used to cancel the effects of a move and to restore the board to a previous status.
    MoveConversionException
    Thrown to indicate a failure converting a move from a textual representation, most likely because of an invalid or unknown syntax.
    MoveException
    Thrown to indicate a failure executing a move, for instance because the move is considered illegal in the context of the game it is played.
    MoveGenerator
    A handy collection of static utility methods for generating moves from a chess position.
    MoveGeneratorException
    Thrown to indicate a failure generating a move.
    MoveList
    A convenient data structure to store an ordered sequence of moves and access to their human-readable representation in one of the standard chess formats.
    MovePerTime
    The representation of the time control moves-per-time, that specifies how many moves must be played within a certain amount of time, for example "40/9000", 40 moves in 9000 seconds, i.e.
    PgnException
    Thrown to indicate a failure reading a Portable Game Notation (PGN) file, for instance because the contents are invalid.
    PgnHolder
    A proxy for accessing a Portable Game Notation (PGN) file.
    PgnIterator
    A Portable Game Notation (PGN) iterator, used to navigate the games contained in PGN file.
    PgnLoadListener
    An observer to PGN loading events, notified when games are extracted from a Portable Game Notation file.
    PgnProperty
    The definition of a Portable Game Notation (PGN) property, also known as tag.
    Piece
    A chess piece on the board, that is, a specific combination of a Side and a PieceType.
    PieceType
    All possible piece types in a chess game.
    Player
    A player of a chess game.
    PlayerType
    The possible types of chess player.
    Rank
    The ranks in a board.
    Round
    A round of a chess event.
    Side
    One of the two sides in a chess game, Side.WHITE or Side.BLACK.
    Square
    All possible squares on a board.
    StringUtil
    A utility collection of operations on strings.
    Termination
    The types of game termination.
    TimeControl
    A generic chess time control used in a game or a chess event.
    TimeControlType
    All possible types of time control.
    UnicodePrinter
    A printer class for conveniently printing boards using Unicode chess symbols in a reliable and consistent way.
    VariationType
    The possible types of chess variation.
    XorShiftRandom
    A utility class that is used to generate pseudorandom numbers bases on XOR and bit shifts operations.
